org.docgene.help.gui.jfx

Class JFXHelpContentViewer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docgene.help.gui.jfx.JFXHelpContentViewer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HelpContentViewer<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.stage.Stage>

    public class JFXHelpContentViewer
extends java.lang.Object
implements HelpContentViewer<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.stage.Stage>
    The JavaFX HelpContentViewer. The JFXHelpContentViewer allows to show the content of a help system in a Swing GUI. The steps to use to use the HelpContentViewer are:
    • Install the ArticlesModel by calling the installModel(org.docgene.help.model.ArticlesModel) method. Note that this can also be performed directly through the JavaHelpFactory by the JavaHelpFactory.install(org.docgene.help.HelpContentViewer) method
    • Get the JFXHelpContentViewer component: getHelpComponent() and add it in your GUI
    • Or alternatively get the HelpContentViewer dialog window: getHelpWindow(javafx.stage.Stage, java.lang.String, int, int) and add it in your GUI
    Adding context-sensitive help on components is performed through the registerContextHelp(java.lang.String, javafx.scene.Node) method.

      • setIcon

        public void setIcon(java.lang.String buttonID,
                    java.net.URL url)
        Set the URL for the icon for a button. The button id can be:
        • HelpContentViewer.ICON_HOME for the home button
        • HelpContentViewer.ICON_FORWARD for the forward button
        • HelpContentViewer.ICON_BACKWARD for the backward button
        • HelpContentViewer.ICON_GLOSSARY for the glossary button
        Specified by:
        setIcon in interface HelpContentViewer<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.stage.Stage>
        Parameters:
        buttonID - the button id
        url - the URL

      • registerContextHelp

        public boolean registerContextHelp(java.lang.String helpID,
                                   javafx.scene.Node node)
        Add a context sensitive help to a Node.
        Specified by:
        registerContextHelp in interface HelpContentViewer<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.stage.Stage>
        Parameters:
        helpID - the helpRef id
        node - the Node
        Returns:
        true if the context sensitive help could be added. It will return false if no helpRef of the specified id exists

      • registerContextHelp

        public boolean registerContextHelp(java.lang.String helpID,
                                   javafx.scene.control.MenuItem item)
        Add a context sensitive help to a MenuItem. Note that for example, the context sensitive help will not be taken into account for MenuItems.
        Parameters:
        helpID - the helpRef id
        item - the MenuItem
        Returns:
        true if the context sensitive help could be added. It will return false if no helpRef of the specified id exists
